items.q: Will Ambilight noticeably hurt gaming FPS?
items.a: Usually not, if capture settings and effect complexity are reasonable. Start with lower smoothing and fewer zones. Detailed steps: /guides/low-latency/.

items.q: Why is my RGB device not detected?
items.a: Most cases are cable, power, or driver/service conflict issues. Check USB cable quality, avoid unstable hubs, and remove competing suites. Full troubleshooting: /compatibility/not-detected/.

items.q: Why do colors look wrong or unstable?
items.a: Check strip order mapping, lower saturation, and verify color channel order. White-balance mismatch is common. Start from setup guide then calibrate: /guides/pc-ambilight-setup-tutorial/.

items.q: How should I choose between Skydimo, OpenRGB, and SignalRGB?
items.a: Pick by scenario first: stable defaults, DIY freedom, or effects ecosystem. Use the decision page first, then compare two finalists. Start here: /best-picks/.

items.q: Can I run vendor RGB software and a universal tool together?
items.a: Not recommended when both control the same device. Conflicting drivers/services are a top source of disconnects and lag. Keep one control plane whenever possible.

items.q: Can I plug ARGB and RGB headers interchangeably?
items.a: No. ARGB is usually 5V 3-pin, RGB is usually 12V 4-pin. Mixing them can damage hardware. Safety guide: /guides/argb-vs-rgb/.

items.q: Should I switch software often to find the best effects?
items.a: Frequent switching increases migration cost and conflict risk. Only migrate when you hit a clear bottleneck in stability or compatibility. Compare before switching: /comparisons/.

items.q: What should I do right after download?
items.a: Skydimo supports official website, Microsoft Store, and Steam downloads. Use one platform path end-to-end without mixing sources, then follow setup steps: /guides/pc-ambilight-setup-tutorial/.
